Description: Clear colourless glass pendant in the form of a lamp, with a circular body and a nozzle pulled out in a rounded knob with a pinched neck. The raised base is formed by an applied disc underneath, the edge of which is pulled out and curved up and over to join the body, forming a handle which acts as the loop of the pendant.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3971)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
